articles.title: Were Trump's initial 2018 tariffs beneficial in hindsight?

articles.title: Should Alabama expand Medicaid to better serve low-income residents?
articles.summary: Assesses coverage gap closure, fiscal effects of enhanced federal match, rural hospital stability, and crowd-out/access concerns.

articles.title: Should Alaska subsidize its tourism industry to improve its economy?
articles.summary: Weighs place-based investment, rising demand (incl. cruise infrastructure), versus overtourism, environmental risks, and subsidy efficacy.

articles.title: Should Arkansas invest more heavily in public schools, rather than private school vouchers?
articles.summary: Analyzes voucher fiscal externalities, achievement evidence, equity/accountability tradeoffs, and claimed benefits of choice/efficiency.

articles.title: Are the arts worth receiving significant federal funding?

articles.title: Should California adopt a single-payer health care system?
articles.summary: Considers universal coverage, admin savings, purchasing power versus tax burden, workforce access, and legal/fiscal hurdles.

articles.title: Has the CHIPS Act provided enough benefits to outweigh its costs in government funding?

articles.title: Would overturning Citizens United v. FEC (2010) improve the democratic process?
articles.summary: Considers transparency and influence limits vs. First Amendment protections, feasibility of amendments, and mixed empirical effects.

articles.title: Should Colorado ban fracking and new oil drilling in light of climate change?
articles.summary: Balances ozone/public health and net‑zero pathways against jobs/revenue, legal hurdles, leakage to other regions, and energy security claims.
